public void run() {
    while (true) {

            socket = new Socket(actuatorAddress, destPort.get());
            outToServer = socket.getOutputStream();
            out = new DataOutputStream(outToServer);
            while (true) {
                out.write(message.getBytes());
                Thread.sleep(1000); // send message every second
            }
        } catch (IOException ex) {
            System.out.println("Server is down, retrying in 5 seconds...");
            try {
                Thread.sleep(5000); // wait 5 seconds before retrying
            } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
                Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
            }
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code creates a new socket connection to the server and sends a message every second. If the server is down, it catches the IOException and waits for 5 seconds before retrying. This process continues indefinitely in a while loop. The DataOutputStream.write method is used to send the message to the server.
